item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 7, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. I algorithmically donated $5000 to Open Source (71 points | 14 comments)
2. Show HN: Countless.dev – A website to compare every AI model: LLMs, TTSs, STTs (92 points | 23 comments)
3. Every V4 UUID (1136 points | 321 comments)
4. Hiroshi Nagai: Japan's Sun-Drenched Americana (79 points | 12 comments)
5. Next-level frosted glass with backdrop-filter (249 points | 38 comments)
6. FSharpPacker – compile F# scripts to executables (29 points | 4 comments)
7. The Curse of Recursion: Training on generated data makes models forget (2023) (77 points | 49 comments)
8. SpiderBasic (22 points | 17 comments)
9. Can life emerge around a white dwarf? (48 points | 29 comments)
10. Biggest shell programs (141 points | 59 comments)
11. My second year without a job (307 points | 412 comments)
12. : The Dialog Element (271 points | 116 comments)
13. Accessing a DRM Framebuffer to display an image (31 points | 5 comments)
14. Lies I was told about collab editing, Part 1: Algorithms for offline editing (220 points | 76 comments)
15. 21 Algol 60 Compilers in 1962 (28 points | 23 comments)
16. OpenAI Reinforcement Fine-Tuning Research Program (181 points | 43 comments)
17. Mathics 7.0 – Open-source alternative to Mathematica (24 points | 3 comments)
18. Nucleotide Transformer: building robust foundation models for human genomics (28 points | 3 comments)
19. Mistakes as a new manager (212 points | 87 comments)
20. MultiQueue-Based FPGA Routing: Relaxed A* Priority Ordering-Improved Parallelism [pdf] (25 points | 2 comments)
21. Install postmarketOS on Android phone and use Docker as a home server (261 points | 101 comments)
22. Structured Outputs with Ollama (206 points | 45 comments)
23. DSPy – Programming–not prompting–LMs (151 points | 27 comments)
24. An invisible desktop application that will help you pass technical interviews (96 points | 91 comments)
25. Does Your Code Pass the Turkey Test? (2008) (108 points | 104 comments)
26. RNA-targeting CRISPR reveals that noncoding RNAs are not 'junk' (131 points | 72 comments)
27. Precursors of Copernicus' heliocentric theory (25 points | 6 comments)
28. Debian opens a can of username worms (217 points | 251 comments)
29. Romanian court annuls result of presidential election first round (475 points | 967 comments)
30. Tokyo is set to introduce a four-day workweek for government employees (569 points | 283 comments)
